purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to remote servers for tracking purposes.
flows: MAC addresses -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains that appear to be from oast.fun and byted-dast.com services
HTTP requests with rejectUnauthorized set to false, potentially indicating TLS bypass
Sending system identifiers to external domains without user consent
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information (MAC addresses, hostname, username) and sends it to external domains through HTTP requests. The presence of hardcoded C2 domains and the use of rejectUnauthorized: false suggests potential malicious activity designed to evade detection while exfiltrating device information.
conclusion: This code demonstrates clear signs of malicious behavior by collecting system information and transmitting it to third-party domains without user consent.
